item.title: PR最好只让我看50行
item.description: The ideal PR is 50 lines long Most engineers intuitively know that smaller code changes are better than big ones. The logical arguments flow easy - small pull requests are easier to review, less likely to have bugs, and are faster from inception to deploy. There are a few papers around this that I love - see the references section at the end of this post for further reading. But how small is small?
